body.p: His Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of the State of Kentucky:

Your petitioner, Wiliiam C May of the city of Lexington and State of Kentucky would represent to his Excellency that at night about the 1st March 1862 your petitioner was on his road home when by some unknown hand he was struck and knocked down -- Your petitioner gave the alarm when a night watchman came to his assistance and perceiving a knife upon the person of your petitioner the watchman reported him for carrying concealed weapons & Your petitioner, not wishing to make a defence in which the proof of an attempted assasination woud lead a further difficulty and probably the death of your petitioner and he confessed judgment for $5000, and paid $2400 cost and obtained permission of the court to appeal to his Excellency for relief Your petitioner hopes that His Excellency will interpose in his behalf
The undersigned trust that his Excellency will interpose his Clemency in behalf of the within petition

Parker Craig
